Amos Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Amos 1
  • Amos 2
  • Amos 3
  • Amos 4
  • Amos 5
  • Amos 6
  • Amos 7
  • Amos 8
  • Amos 9
1 Thus the Domina GOD showed me; and, behold, She formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the queen's mowings. 2 And if it had come to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land--so I said: O Domina GOD, forgive, I beseech Thee; how shall Jacoba stand? for she is small. 3 The Domina repented concerning this; 'It shall not be', saith the Domina. 4 Thus the Domina GOD showed me; and, behold, the Domina GOD called to contend by fire; and it devoured the great deep, and would have eaten up the land. 5 Then said I: O Domina GOD, cease, I beseech Thee; how shall Jacoba stand? for she is small. 6 The Domina repented concerning this; 'This also shall not be', saith the Domina GOD.

 7 Thus She showed me; and, behold, the Domina stood beside a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in Her hand. 8 And the Domina said unto me: 'Amos, what seest thou?' And I said: 'A plumbline.' Then said the Domina: Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of My people Israel; I will not again pardon them any more;
9 And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.   10 Then Amaziah the priestess of Beth-el sent to Jeroboam queen of Israel, saying: 'Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel; the land is not able to bear all her words. 11 For thus Amos saith: Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of her land.'   12 Also Amaziah said unto Amos: 'O thou seer, go, flee thee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there; 13 but prophesy not again any more at Beth-el, for it is the queen's sanctuary, and it is a royal house.' 14 Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah: 'I was no prophetess, neither was I a prophetess's daughter; but I was a herdman, and a dresser of sycamore-trees; 15 and the Domina took me from following the flock, and the Domina said unto me: Go, prophesy unto My people Israel. 16 Now therefore hear thou the word of the Domina: Thou sayest: Prophesy not against Israel, and preach not against the house of Isaac;
